name: MIT Police (emergency)
description: To contact police, ambulance, fire, or a dean-on-call, or to file a report. Can also dial **100** from any campus phone.

name: Nationwide Emergency Services
description: For emergencies off campus in the United States.

name: MIT Police (non-emergency)
description: For general MIT police business and lost and found.

name: MIT Medical Urgent Care
description: MIT Medical urgent care is open 8:00AM–8:00PM, Monday through Friday and 10:00AM–4:00PM, Saturday and Sunday. Clinical advice is available via phone when closed.

name: Student Mental Health Support
description: Mental health and counseling resources for students.

name: MIT MyLife Services (Employees)
description: Provides MIT faculty, staff, postdocs, and adult household members with 24/7 access to a network of experts who are available to help with life concerns.

name: Violence Prevention and Response
description: Resources for survivors of sexual assault/harassment, domestic/dating violence, stalking, and/or any violence, etc.

name: International Travel Emergencies (International SOS)
description: For medical and security services while traveling abroad on official MIT business.

name: Environmental Health and Safety
description: For minor hazardous materials incidents and general EHS business.
